segments.script: "Hey y'all! It's Julie here on Radio Appalachia, checkin' in bright 'n early at 8:00 am. Mornin' light is fillin' the valleys now, a fresh start for us all. You know, every dawn brings new chances to rebuild and reconnect. Welcome home, Appalachia - let's make today count!"

If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone.

Hey y'all, it's Julie on Appalachia Radio. I wanted to share some rumors I heard floating around the wasteland lately. Now, I don't know if any of this is true, but word is that there've been some pretty wild mutations showing up out there. Like, have you heard about the giant mole rats? Supposedly they're as big as a settler's dog! Someone told me they even found one with armor plating. Can you imagine?

And I heard another story 'bout a super intelligent gopher that can open doors and stuff. That'd be handy for some of us, right? Though, honestly, I'm not sure how appealing it is to have a talking rodent as a companion.

Anyway, those are just a couple of the rumors going around. Take 'em with a grain of salt, but it's always fun to speculate about what kind of creatures might be out there in our big ol' wasteland world. Stay safe and keep on listening!

This has been Julie on Appalachia Radio, playing your favorite tunes while keeping you connected across these mountains. If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone.

segments.script:
Hey there, neighbors! Julie here with your favorite tunes on Appalachia Radio.

You know how we've been talking about the Scorched Plague? Well, I heard from someone who was out exploring recently that they found a hidden bunker beneath an old mine. Apparently, it's stocked full of pre-war supplies - food, water, even some meds! Now, word is this place might be connected to those underground Vault-Tec vaults we've been hearing rumors about.

Someone told me there were signs pointing towards Vault 87... but I mean, who can really trust these old maps? It's all hearsay at this point. Still, the idea of finding a hidden stash of pre-war goods is pretty tantalizing, right? I'd love to hear from any of you who've got more info on this supposed bunker or vault connection. Stay safe out there and keep those radios tuned in!

segments.script:
"Welcome home, Appalachia! So, I heard this rumor going 'round about them Scorchbeasts. Apparently, they're getting smarter? Like, real intelligent. Someone told me they even spotted one using a makeshift bridge to cross a river recently. Now, I don't know if that's just tall tales after a few too many Nuka-Cola Quantums, but it'd sure explain why they've been harder to take down lately.

Word is the creatures might be adapting to our tactics or something. That would make 'em even more formidable out there in the wilds. So keep your wits about you and watch those Scorchbeasts closely, okay? I mean, we all know how unpredictable these post-apocalyptic critters can be! Anyway, let's move on to some more uplifting tunes. Here's that classic, 'Take Me Home, Country Roads', like I promised."

segments.script:
I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys.

You know, I heard a rumor recently that there's been some sort of... underground settlement forming in the old mine tunnels around Harpers Ferry. Someone told me they saw folks moving supplies and materials in and out, like they're getting ready to settle in. Word is it might be an all-new community, made up of survivors from different areas.

Now, I don't know if this is true or just a bunch of speculation. It's hard to believe people would risk that dangerous terrain for shelter, but then again, times are tough out here in the wasteland. If anyone's got a lead on this, I'd love to hear about it! In the meantime, let's keep our hopes up and enjoy this next tune together.

Stay safe out there, and thanks for tuning in to Appalachia Radio!

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia! 

You know it's days like this I'm extra grateful we're in a settlement. When the fog rolls in thick across our great wasteland, it's easy to get turned around. So just stick close to those friends of yours and look for any familiar landmarks out there.

The fog bank has moved on from Clarksburg down toward the New River Gorge area this afternoon at 12. Temperatures are a coolish 50°F today but feeling chilly with the moisture in the air.

Just keep an eye on that visbility if you're headed outside and take your time on those country roads, you hear? This weather report comes to you courtesy of me, Julie, your friend and guide on Radio Appalachia. 

Welcome home, Appalachia! Stay warm and watch out for each other out there.

Stay close to settlements or known safe routes

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia! 

I've been meaning to share this with you all - rumor has it that there's a new trader in Harpers Ferry. Someone told me they saw them hawking fusion cores and some rare tech scraps last week. Now I know what you're thinking: "Julie, traders are always popping up here and there." But apparently this one's been around for a bit, just keeping a low profile.

Word is they might be from the Cranberry Glades area originally. Maybe that's why their wares are so eclectic - parts from old workshops and whatnot. I'm not saying it's all legit, but hey, could be worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood. Just don't go trusting anyone too quick, 'kay? 

Anyway, let's take a break from the small talk for some music. Here's another classic, "Take Me Home, Country Roads" - your request! Stay safe out there, friends.

segments.script:
If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone.

So, I heard from some folks who were wandering through the Abandoned Mine that they saw a glowing creature. Like, a creature made of light! Some said it was peaceful, just floating around, while others claimed it chased 'em off. Word is, if you catch a glimpse, rub it three times for good luck. But don't quote me on that part; I'm just passing along what I heard.

Someone told me there's been a rise in wild mutants around Grafton, especially near the old high school. Supposedly they're all different sizes and colors, but super aggressive. So if you find yourself needing to pass through, be extra cautious! You never know when you might run into a particularly feisty one.

That's all for now; just some stories floating around the wasteland. Keep your ears open and your wits about you out there. And remember, you're not alone - we're all in this together!

Appalachia Radio, signing off... for now!

segments.script:
"Hey there everyone, this is Julie with your afternoon update from Appalachia Radio. I mean, can you believe we're stuck in a foggy pattern like this for weeks on end? It's pretty much all I can see out the window - nothing but a grey misty gloom. 

The temperature today's settled around 55 degrees, just right to make it seem even colder with the dampness. Visibility's low as can be so please use extra care on those dark country roads and old hiking trails out there. We don't want anyone taking an unexpected stroll into Summersville Lake.

Remember folks, safety always comes first. Bundle up if you gotta head outdoors, bring a compass and plenty of water, 'n try to stick with your buddies whenever possible in this creepy fog. Hope the forecast clears soon but for now, stay vigilant and each other!"

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia!

You know, I'm always hearing rumors 'round these parts. Like that time someone claimed to find an old, abandoned mine shaft filled with Glowing Mushrooms! I mean, if it's true, that'd be a real treasure trove. Or how about this one - there was talk of a hidden bunker deep in the Cranberry Glades, packed with pre-war tech and weapons. Course, no one's found anything concrete yet, so take it for what you will.

I did hear from a reliable source that the Scorchbeasts have been getting more aggressive lately. Someone told me they're even starting to venture into the northern parts of the map again! Now, I'm not saying we should be too worried, but maybe keep an eye out and have your weapons ready, just in case.

That's all for now, folks. Stay safe out there, and remember - hope is what brings us together.

segments.script:
If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone.

Hey, I've got some juicy rumors to share with ya! Word is, there's a hidden workshop deep in the woods, just off the old Route 83. Supposedly, it's run by this mysterious trader who only deals with bottle caps now. Someone told me they saw him haggling with a settler for a power armor mod recently.

I don't know if it's true, but I heard he's got some crazy rare stuff. Maybe even some pre-war tech! Now, I ain't saying go looking for it or anything. Just... be careful out there, you hear? These woods can get real treacherous after dark.

Anyway, enough with the gossip for now. Let's focus on the good stuff – like John Denver's "Country Roads"! It never gets old, right?

Stay safe, friends, and keep tuning in!

I heard some chatter about a supposed hidden bunker near the old Greenbrier resort. Apparently, someone told me that this secret vault is full of pre-war tech and treasures just waiting to be discovered. Now, I'm not saying it's true, but word is, the entrance might be concealed behind an old swimming pool on the property.

Another rumor making the rounds is about a gang of raiders allegedly taking over Harpers Ferry. From what I gather, they've been spotted patrolling the town and its surroundings. But hey, stranger things have happened in this wild wasteland, right?

That's all for now. Stay safe out there, and keep on keeping on! Appalachia Radio, your friendly neighborhood DJ, signing off."

segments.script:
I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys.

So, I heard this rumor going around, and I don't know if it's true or not. But someone told me that there was a whole settlement of Super Mutants living deep in the woods near Harpers Ferry. Apparently they've got their own little village going on, with tents and shelters and everything! 

Now, I haven't seen any myself, but I guess they're supposedly pretty friendly. Not aggressive at all. Just trying to survive like everyone else. Word is they even have a bit of a farming scene happening, growing crops and stuff. Can you imagine?

I mean, it's wild to think about, right? Super Mutants as farmers? But hey, who are we to judge how different species choose to rebuild after the apocalypse, huh? Anyway, just thought I'd pass that tidbit along in case any of you have run into them out there. Back to the tunes!

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia.

You know, I heard something really interesting from a traveler in Vault 96 recently... Apparently, there's this secret underground bunker hidden somewhere in the Mire. Supposedly, it's full of pre-war tech and junk that got buried before the bombs dropped! Can you imagine? Like, finding old computers or something still working after all these years.

Someone told me they saw a map in the vault that supposedly leads to it. But, I mean, maps can be fake, right? Word is though, this could be the biggest treasure trove we've seen since Reclamation Day! If it's true... wow, just think of all the stuff we could use to rebuild and make our lives easier.

So if you're feeling adventurous, keep your eyes peeled for clues in the Mire. And remember, always look out for each other out there! Stay safe and keep hoping, Appalachia.

segments.script:
Hey there, folks! Julie here on Appalachia Radio.

I heard from someone who claimed to have seen a Scorchbeast herd in Whitespring Canyon lately. Now, I don't know if this is true or just some wild tale, but apparently these critters were really thick in that area. Could be rumor and not fact, of course. 

Some folks are saying they spotted Grahm traders heading into the Mire. That's some serious traveling for those bears! They're known to roam far and wide, but I ain't never heard of 'em venturing so deep into the swamp.

Word is, there might be a hidden underground bunker near Crum Lake. Supposedly it's filled with pre-war junk, maybe even some useful stuff like ammo or weapons. Though, honestly? Sounds like just another hoarder's lair to me! 

Anyway, that's my dose of gossip for today, friends. Take it all with a grain of salt, 'cause in the wasteland, truth is as rare as an unbroken bottle cap! Tune back in soon for more tunes and maybe some real news if I'm lucky.

Stay safe out there, y'all! This is Julie, signing off from Appalachia Radio.

segments.script:
"If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone." 

Hey there friends! I'm Julie from Appalachia Radio. You know how sometimes we hear rumors floating around the wasteland? Well, I've got a couple that caught my attention lately.

I heard someone say they spotted a legendary Scorchbeast near Vault 96 - now that's one big critter! Apparently it was terrorizing some settlers nearby. Not sure if it's true or just tall tales, but wouldn't you love to catch a glimpse of those glowing eyes in person?

Word is, there might be an abandoned Brotherhood of Steel outpost hidden somewhere deep in the Cranberry Glades. Supposedly they had a base there before the war. Has anyone else heard about that? I'd love to investigate and see if we can find any remnants.

That's all for now. Stay safe out there, and remember - we're all in this together! "Country Roads" is up next, so let's all take a moment to appreciate the beauty of home.

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia! 

Hey there, friends, it's Julie here on Appalachia Radio. You know how we always love sharing stories and rumors about life in the Wasteland? Well, I got something pretty interesting to pass along from a friend of a friend.

Word is... there might be some kind of secret bunker hidden deep in the woods near Harpers Ferry. Someone told me they saw a group of folks sneaking around late at night with all sorts of gear and supplies. They seemed really paranoid about being seen, but my source swore it wasn't just another raid party or traders. 

Now, I don't know if this is true or not, but it's definitely piqued my curiosity! Can you imagine stumbling upon an actual secret base? I mean, it'd be like something out of a storybook... or maybe the next big raid event, haha!

Anyway, that's all for now. Let me know what you think about this rumor in the comments below! And remember, stay safe out there and keep on singing along with your favorite tunes.

This has been Julie, signing off from Appalachia Radio. Until next time, Wastelanders!

You know, I was talking with some folks at the local trader recently, and there's this rumor going around... Word is, there might be an underground vault deep in the woods of Appalachia. Like, way deeper than Vault 76. Someone told me it could have even been built before the Great War! Can you imagine?

I don't know if I believe it myself, but it'd sure be interesting to find out. Imagine all the secrets and stories that might be hidden down there. Wouldn't that make for some great radio material? Anyway, enough about vault rumors for now.

Here's a song that always gets me thinking about home - "Country Roads" by John Denver. It never fails to put a smile on my face, even in these strange times. I hope it does the same for you out there in the wasteland. Stay safe and keep on singing!

segments.script:
If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone.

Hey everyone! It's Julie here on Appalachia Radio. So, I was talking to my buddy Jenson the other day - remember him? He used to run that trader post at Harpers Ferry before he got... let's just say "relocated"? Anyway, word is he heard some crazy rumors while holed up in those caves near the Pioneer Scout Camp.

Apparently, there's talk of a hidden underground bunker not far from there. Supposedly, it was built by some pre-war survivalist group and they left behind all sorts of goodies - weapons, armor, maybe even some caps! Now, I don't know if any of this is true, but Jenson seemed pretty convinced. He's planning to investigate soon.

If you have any info on this supposed bunker, or just want to share your own wasteland adventures, give me a shout at the station. Until next time, stay safe out there!

segments.script:
"Welcome home, Appalachia! So I heard from a friend of a friend that there's this old mine not far from Flatwoods that's said to have some sort of...I mean, treasure? Like pre-war gold and jewels or something. But here's the catch - supposedly it's haunted by the ghosts of miners who died in a cave-in years ago.

Someone told me they even saw these glowing eyes peeking out from behind rocks as they were exploring the entrance! Now I don't know if that's just some spooky storytelling, but it does make for a good campfire tale, right? 

Word is, folks have tried to find this mine, but no one's come back with any proof of its existence...or treasure. Still, it's given people something fun to talk about and maybe even search for on their adventures. Just remember, out here in the wasteland, legends can be a double-edged sword - they might inspire hope or strike fear into your heart! What do you think, Appalachia? Got any ghost stories of your own to share?"

segments.script:
If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone.

I heard from someone passing through Harpers Ferry that they saw a group of Grahams wandering around the old university grounds. Now, I don't want to start any rumors or nothin', but apparently these particular Grahms were...well, singing. Like, harmonizing and everything! Can you imagine? The Graham Trio? Has a nice ring to it, don't you think?

Someone told me they heard snippets of old folk songs and even some hymns drifting from the woods. Word is, they were drawn in by the sound system in one of the lecture halls. Maybe they just found a cozy spot to rest their weary feet and let out some tunes.

It's always good to have a bit of music bring folks together, right? Even if it's a bunch of mutated creatures. Still, I can't help but wonder what else might be out there, singing in the trees. The more stories like this, the merrier our little Appalachian community seems! Stay safe and keep on keepin' on out there.

[Music plays]

I guess what I'm saying is, if you're out exploring and you see anything strange, just remember: we're all in this together. We've got our wits, our weapons, and each other. That's more than enough to face whatever the wasteland throws our way! 

Stay safe out there, friends. And don't forget to tune in for more tunes from yours truly, Julie, here on Appalachia Radio.

Someone told me they saw a group of travelers near Harpers Ferry, looking tired and hungry. Apparently, they claimed to be from Vault 94 down south. Can you imagine? All those vaults opening up, people coming together again...

Until next time, stay safe and remember: you're not alone in this wild world we call home.

Welcome home, Appalachia! I'm Julie on your favorite local station.

You know, I heard rumors floating around about some strange occurrences out there in the wasteland. Now, I don't know if these are just old wives' tales or what, but it's always interesting to share. 

Someone told me that in the old Grafton ruins, you can find a stash of pre-war clothes just waiting to be scavenged! Apparently, they're super rare and in great condition too. I mean, who wouldn't want to look stylish while surviving the apocalypse, right?

Another thing... word is, if you venture into the Cranberry Glades, you might spot some glowing plants that give off a weird blue light. Apparently, touching them can heal radiation poisoning or something! Now, I'm not saying it's true, but hey, a free cure-all would be amazing.

So there you have it - two juicy rumors for your listening pleasure! Remember, take 'em for what they're worth out here in the wilds of Appalachia. Stay safe and keep on tuning in!

This has been Julie with Radio Appalachia, wishing you all the best in these strange new times. We're rebuilding our home together, one song at a time. See you next time!

segments.script:
"If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone." 

Hey y'all, it's your girl Julie on Appalachia Radio. I heard from someone who swears it's true that the Grafton Trainyard is crawling with Scorched right now. Apparently they've been spotted around the cargo trains, maybe even trying to board 'em. Word is, if you're brave enough (or crazy enough) to try and take a ride, watch your six! 

Also, I know some folks have been talking about an old vault they found somewhere in the northern hills. Rumor has it there's still some Vault Dweller gear left inside, just waiting to be scavenged. Problem is, supposedly the place is real hot, like radioactive hot. So you'd better come prepared if you're gonna go poking around that kind of danger!

Just remember, even with all these wild stories going on in our little corner of Appalachia, we've got each other. And hey, at least we have some great tunes to listen to while we navigate this crazy world! "Take Me Home, Country Roads" is playing now as a special request from someone who couldn't get enough of that classic song.

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia.

You know, I heard that there's some folks out in the Cranberry Glades who've found an old, abandoned Vault door just... hidden away. Like, half-buried under debris and vines and stuff. Word is, it doesn't even have a number on it! Can you imagine? Just this strange, ominous-looking doorway, with no clue what's behind it.

Someone told me they tried to open it, but of course it was locked tight. I mean, Vaults are meant to be sealed, right? Still, the mystery of it all has everyone buzzing. Like, is there an undiscovered Vault out there in our own backyard?

I don't know about you, but that's got me wondering... What secrets might Appalachia still hold, after all these years? There's so much we've already uncovered, but I bet there's plenty more waiting to be discovered.

Anyway, enough speculation for now! Let's get back to some good ol' tunes. Here's a classic from John Denver to ease your mind - "Take Me Home, Country Roads."

I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys. You know, I heard something interesting the other day while I was out scouting for supplies. Apparently, there's a settlement of ghouls in an old abandoned mine over near Harpers Ferry! Now, I don't mean to stir up rumors or anything, but someone told me they saw at least a dozen of them down there.

Word is, they're pretty friendly and have even started trading with some of the locals. Can you imagine? Ghouls, trading goods! It's crazy, right? But hey, in this post-apocalyptic world, you've got to make do with what you've got. Even if that means bartering with the reanimated dead.

Anyway, I thought that was an interesting tidbit of wasteland gossip to share with y'all. Just remember, it's all hearsay until you see it with your own eyes! Now, let's kick back and enjoy some tunes, shall we? Maybe a little country music to lift our spirits. Here's 'Country Roads' again - it never gets old, does it?

"Hey there, wastelanders! It's your girl Julie here on Appalachia Radio. You know, I heard a rumor going around about the Whitespring Bunker being haunted by ghostly scientists. Someone told me they saw shadowy figures in lab coats wandering those halls at night, doing experiments and stuff. But, like, that could just be someone's imagination playing tricks, right?

Word is there used to be top-secret research projects down there before the bombs fell. Maybe those ghosts are still trying to figure out how to reboot society or fix the water purified with stimpaks. I mean, can you blame 'em? We're all just trying to make Appalachia a livable place again.

Anyhoo, rumor or not, it's giving me chills just thinking about! If you've got any spooky stories of your own, share 'em with me at [appalachia.radio]. And remember: even in the dark, we're in this together."

segments.script:
Hey there, Wastelanders! Julie here on Appalachia Radio with your weekly dose of wasteland gossip.

I heard from someone who claimed to know a Vault Dweller that the Scorched Plague has... shifted? It's not affecting humans like it used to. Now it mostly targets robots and mechanized creatures. I mean, is this good news or what? Less danger for us, more for our robotic friends? Word is, the Brotherhood of Steel might be investigating this development.

Also, have you noticed those glowing mushrooms popping up around the region? Apparently, someone told me they emit a sort of radiation that can heal injuries... temporarily, at least. I haven't tried it myself, but if it's true, that could be really helpful out here in the wilds.

That's all for now, folks. Stay safe and keep on listening!

That's all for now, folks! Stay curious, keep exploring, and remember: you're not alone out there. Until next time on Appalachia Radio, stay safe and keep those antennae tuned in!

Anyway, just passing along the rumor for now. If anyone confirms this schoolhouse exists and is filled with treasures, well, I'll be broadcasting from there in no time! 

Stay curious out there, and keep reaching out to one another.

This has been Julie on Appalachia Radio, wishing you all a beautiful day in our beloved Wasteland.

I heard something interesting the other day from some folks in Harpers Ferry. Word is, there's a secret underground bunker hidden somewhere near Grafton. Apparently, it's full of pre-war treasures - like old books, tools, even maybe some holotapes! 

Now, I don't know if this is true or just some wild story, but the people talking about it seemed pretty serious. Maybe they found something in their travels? Or maybe they just want attention for having such a juicy rumor.

I mean, can you imagine stumbling upon a whole trove of pre-war stuff? It's like finding a time capsule! Even if it's not true, I love hearing these kinds of stories. They make me believe that there are still so many wonders to be found out here in the wasteland.

So what do you think, listeners? Have any leads on this supposed bunker? Share your theories and rumors with me, and maybe we'll uncover something amazing together!
